SEARCH
Package com.example.hive.Events

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.hive.Events.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.os.Parcelable
public class Event extends Object implements android.os.Parcelable
Class to represent an event. Implements Parcelable in order to be passed via Intent.
Author:
Zach
See Also:
  • Parcelable

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      No-argument constructor for Firestore.

    • Event

      public Event(String title, String cost, long startDateInMS, long endDateInMS, @Nullable String firebaseID, String description, int numParticipants, String location, @Nullable String poster, long selectionDate, @Nullable Integer entrantLimit, String duration, boolean geolocation, boolean replacementDrawAllowed, boolean isLotteryDrawn)
      Event constructor. Creates a new event object with provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      title - String: The event title.
      cost - String: The cost of the event. Should be in format "00.00"
      startDateInMS - long: Start date in the format of milliseconds since epoch.
      endDateInMS - long: End date in the format of milliseconds since epoch.
      firebaseID - String: Nullable: The ID of the related event document in Firestore.
      description - String: The event description.
      numParticipants - int: The number of participants to be selected for this event.
      location - String: The location of the event, i.e. facility. Note that this will be converted to be an instance of a Facility object in the future.
      poster - String: Nullable: The download URL of the event poster related to this event that is stored in Firebase cloud storage.
      selectionDate - long: The date when participant selection occurs.
      entrantLimit - Integer: Nullable: The maximum number of entrants allowed.
      duration - String: The duration of the event.
      geolocation - boolean: Whether geolocation is enabled for this event.
      replacementDrawAllowed - boolean: Whether replacement draws are allowed.
      isLotteryDrawn - boolean: Whether the lottery has been drawn.

    • Event

      protected Event(@NonNull android.os.Parcel in)
      Required function to create an event object from a Parcel
      Parameters:
      in - Parcel: The Parcel object to unpack
      See Also:
      • Parcel

    • getStartTime

      public String getStartTime()
      Getter to get start time in human readable format. Returns time as "hh:mm" i.e. "09:00". Note that this uses the 24Hr clock, i.e. 9:00 p.m. is "21:00"
      Returns:
      The time in human readable format

    • getEndTime

      public String getEndTime()
      Getter to get end time in human readable format. Returns time as "hh:mm" i.e. "09:00". Note that this uses the 24Hr clock, i.e. 9:00 p.m. is "21:00"
      Returns:
      The time in human readable format

    • getDateInDashFormat

      public String getDateInDashFormat(String whichDate)
      Gets date in dash-separated format (dd-MM-yyyy).
      Parameters:
      whichDate - String: Which date to format ("start", "end", or "selection").
      Returns:
      The formatted date string, or empty string if invalid date type provided.

    • getDateAndTimeFromMS

      public String[] getDateAndTimeFromMS(long dateInMS)
      Converts a date and time in MS since epoch to a human readable format. Constructed as "mmm dd-hh:mm". Returned as an array whose first element is date, second is time.
      Parameters:
      dateInMS - The date in MS since epoch to convert.
      Returns:
      The String array containing the date and time.
